filmography.title: My Cousin Rachel
filmography.role_description: A young Englishman who suspects his cousin's widow of murder but falls in love with her, marking Burton's Hollywood breakthrough.
filmography.plot: A young man plots revenge against the woman he believes murdered his cousin, but his plans are complicated when he falls under her spell.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – New Star of the Year

filmography.title: The Desert Rats
filmography.role_description: A tough British captain put in charge of an unruly Australian division defending Tobruk against Rommel's forces.
filmography.plot: During WWII, a British officer leads a group of Australian soldiers in the stubborn defense of Tobruk against the German army.

filmography.title: The Robe
filmography.role_description: A Roman tribune who commands the unit that crucifies Jesus and is later tormented by guilt and the power of Christ's robe.
filmography.plot: In the Roman province of Judea, a Roman tribune commands the unit that crucifies Jesus, but he is forever changed by the experience.

filmography.title: Alexander the Great
filmography.role_description: The legendary Macedonian king and military genius who conquers the known world while battling his own inner demons.
filmography.plot: The life and conquests of Alexander the Great, from his youth in Macedonia to his vast campaigns across Asia.

filmography.title: Bitter Victory
filmography.role_description: A cynical, experienced British officer who clashes with his incompetent commander during a dangerous commando raid in Libya.
filmography.plot: Two British officers are sent on a mission to raid German headquarters in Benghazi, but personal conflicts threaten the operation.

filmography.title: Look Back in Anger
filmography.role_description: An angry, disaffected working-class man in a love triangle, representing the 'angry young men' generation of British cinema.
filmography.plot: A disillusioned, college-educated market porter takes out his frustration on his upper-class wife and the world around him.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best British Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: A British RAF pilot who engages in a memorable exchange with a fellow wounded American soldier on D-Day.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

filmography.title: Cleopatra
filmography.role_description: The Roman general whose passionate and doomed love affair with Cleopatra leads to war and his own destruction.
filmography.plot: Queen Cleopatra VII of Egypt experiences triumph and tragedy through her romances with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

filmography.title: The V.I.P.s
filmography.role_description: A wealthy industrialist who attempts to stop his wife from leaving him for a playboy while grounded at a fog-bound airport.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers are delayed at London Heathrow Airport due to fog, forcing them to confront the crises in their personal lives.

filmography.title: Becket
filmography.role_description: The Archbishop of Canterbury who evolves from the King's hedonistic companion to a devout defender of the Church, leading to martyrdom.
filmography.plot: King Henry II surprises England by naming his drinking partner Thomas Becket as Archbishop of Canterbury, but their friendship turns to bitter rivalry.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Night of the Iguana
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic, defrocked priest working as a tour guide in Mexico who faces a mental breakdown at a run-down hotel.
filmography.plot: A defrocked Episcopal priest leads a busload of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with his demons.

filmography.title: The Spy Who Came In from the Cold
filmography.role_description: A burnt-out British intelligence agent who agrees to one final, dangerous mission in East Germany.
filmography.plot: A British spy is sent to East Germany in a plot to sow disinformation about a high-ranking East German intelligence officer.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best British Actor

filmography.title: The Sandpiper
filmography.role_description: A married Episcopal school headmaster who engages in an illicit affair with a free-spirited artist living in Big Sur.
filmography.plot: A free-spirited artist living in Big Sur begins an adulterous affair with the headmaster of the school her son attends.

filmography.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
filmography.role_description: A downtrodden history professor who engages in a vicious, alcohol-fueled night of psychological warfare with his wife Martha.
filmography.plot: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other during the course of a night.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best British Actor

filmography.title: The Taming of the Shrew
filmography.role_description: A boisterous, fortune-seeking gentleman who marries an ill-tempered woman and attempts to 'tame' her through psychological manipulation.
filmography.plot: Brutish, fortune-hunting Petruchio marries a wealthy, shrewish woman and proceeds to 'tame' her to his will.

filmography.title: The Comedians
filmography.role_description: A cynical hotel owner in Haiti who becomes reluctantly involved in the political turmoil of the Papa Doc Duvalier regime.
filmography.plot: The cynical owner of a hotel in Haiti becomes involved with a group of rebels and the wife of a foreign ambassador.

filmography.title: Doctor Faustus
filmography.role_description: A scholar who sells his soul to the devil in exchange for knowledge and power; Burton also co-directed this film.
filmography.plot: A man sells his soul to the devil in exchange for knowledge, power, and the love of the most beautiful woman in the world.

filmography.title: Boom!
filmography.role_description: A mysterious poet and gigolo, nicknamed the 'Angel of Death', who visits a dying wealthy woman on her private island.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman nearing death encounters a poet who may or may not be the Angel of Death.

filmography.title: Where Eagles Dare
filmography.role_description: The leader of an elite Allied commando team sent to rescue a general from a Bavarian castle, managing double agents along the way.
filmography.plot: Allied agents stage a daring raid on a castle where the Nazis are holding an American general prisoner... but that's not all that's really going on.

filmography.title: Anne of the Thousand Days
filmography.role_description: The powerful English monarch whose obsession with Anne Boleyn leads him to break with the Catholic Church.
filmography.plot: King Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Katharine of Aragon, for a new love, Anne Boleyn, who will ultimately face the executioner.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Staircase
filmography.role_description: An aging, bickering barber living with his partner in London, dealing with family issues and legal troubles.
filmography.plot: An aging gay couple who own a barber shop in London struggle with their relationship and personal crises.

filmography.title: Villain
filmography.role_description: A sadistic, mother-obsessed London gangster who plans a payroll heist, portraying a gritty and violent criminal.
filmography.plot: A ruthless London gangster with a mother fixation and a penchant for violence plans a major robbery.

filmography.title: The Assassination of Trotsky
filmography.role_description: The exiled Russian revolutionary living in Mexico, spending his final days writing and dictating while an assassin circles.
filmography.plot: The last days of Leon Trotsky in exile in Mexico in 1940, leading up to his assassination by a Stalinist agent.

filmography.title: Equus
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist suffering from professional burnout who tries to understand why a young boy blinded six horses.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist attempts to uncover the reason why a stable boy blinded six horses with a metal spike.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Medusa Touch
filmography.role_description: A telekinetic novelist who discovers he has the power to cause disasters just by thinking about them.
filmography.plot: A French detective investigates a writer who has been attacked and discovers the victim possesses the power to cause catastrophes.

filmography.title: The Wild Geese
filmography.role_description: A mercenary leader hired to rescue a deposed African president, leading a team of aging soldiers on a dangerous mission.
filmography.plot: A British banker hires a group of mercenaries to rescue a deposed African president from a corrupt dictator.

filmography.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking member of the Inner Party who tortures and re-educates the protagonist; Burton's final film role.
filmography.plot: In a totalitarian future society, a man whose daily work is rewriting history tries to rebel by falling in love.
